name: Early Jazz / New Orleans
description: The birthplace of jazz, emerging from the cultural melting pot of New Orleans. This era saw the fusion of African rhythms, blues, ragtime, and brass band traditions into a new, improvisational art form.

name: Swing Era
description: The golden age of big bands and dance music. Swing brought jazz into the mainstream, with large orchestras playing arranged music that emphasized rhythm and melody.

name: Bebop
description: A revolutionary movement that transformed jazz from dance music into an art form for listening. Bebop featured complex harmonies, fast tempos, and virtuosic improvisation.

name: Cool Jazz
description: A reaction to bebop's intensity, cool jazz emphasized relaxed tempos, lighter tones, and sophisticated arrangements. It brought a more restrained, contemplative approach to improvisation.

name: Hard Bop
description: A return to jazz's roots, hard bop incorporated gospel, blues, and R&B influences. It maintained bebop's complexity while adding a more soulful, funky feel.

name: Free Jazz / Avant-Garde
description: Breaking free from conventional structures, free jazz abandoned fixed chord changes and often standard rhythm. It was a radical exploration of sound and expression.

name: Fusion
description: The electric revolution. Fusion combined jazz improvisation with rock rhythms, electric instruments, and funk grooves, creating a high-energy hybrid genre.

name: Contemporary / Modern
description: Modern jazz encompasses diverse styles from neo-traditionalism to avant-garde experimentation, hip-hop fusion, and electronic influences. It honors tradition while pushing boundaries.
